bibl.title: Mito y magia en Grecia y Roma

bibl.seg: Giulia Sfameni Gasparro, Tra mageutiké téchne e teologia: i PGM come testimoni della religiosità tardo-antica.
Emilio Suárez de la Torre & Aurelio Pérez Jiménez (edd.), Mito y magia en Grecia y Roma = Supplementa Μήνη. 1 (Barcelona, 2013) pp. 161-177.

The analysis of the Great Magical Papyrus of Paris (P.G.M. IV) shows a strong convergence of ritual ability (mageutiké téchne) and of theological discourse (logos tes theologias). The result is a new ""theology"" where the religious traditions of the various peoples of the Mediterranean world - in particular Greeks, Egyptians and Jews - merge in a vast cosmosophic perspective with strong solar marks. - Avec résumés en italien et en anglais.
